content.question: The misunderstanding discussed in Paragraph 3 is that many who study Franklin

choices.label: ascribe greater geniality to Franklin than his actions support
confuse Franklin's public statements with his private beliefs
believe that Franklin had a fundamental faith that in fact he lacked
rely too much on government records in their analysis of Franklin

content.answer: confuse Franklin's public statements with his private beliefs

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain ways claims are qualified through modifiers, counterarguments, and alternative perspectives.
